alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 17 at 4:20PM EDT until March 18 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Lake effect snow with occasional heavy snowfall expected. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches, locally up to 10 inches in the higher terrain from west of Big Bay to Negaunee, Ishpeming and Skandia. The heaviest snow will fall between 2 AM EDT tonight and noon EDT on Saturday. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph, especially close to Lake Superior, leading to blowing snow. Expect the strongest winds and most significant blowing snow to occur mid morning Saturday through the afternoon. * WHERE...Marquette County. * WHEN...Until 8 PM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel will become difficult in some areas, especially late tonight and Saturday. Patchy blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. Highway M-28 east of Harvey will become especially impacted by blowing snow and low visibility from mid morning on Saturday through Saturday afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
